medsegpy.data package¶

class medsegpy.data.MetadataCatalog[source]¶

Bases: object

MetadataCatalog provides access to “Metadata” of a given dataset.

The metadata associated with a certain name is a singleton: once created, the metadata will stay alive and will be returned by future calls to get(name).

It’s like global variables, so don’t abuse it. It’s meant for storing knowledge that’s constant and shared across the execution of the program, e.g.: the class names in OAI iMorphics.

static get(name)[source]¶
Parameters

name (str) – name of a dataset (e.g. oai_2d_train).

Returns

Metadata – The Metadata instance associated with this name, or create an empty one if none is available.

abstract img_generator(state: medsegpy.data.im_gens.GeneratorState)[source]¶

Data generator that yields (inputs, outputs) during Keras training This method should be passed to the data_generator field when training with Keras :param state: A GeneratorState - either TRAINING or VALIDATION

abstract img_generator_test(model=None)[source]¶

Data generator that yields (inputs, outputs-ground truth, predictions, scan_identifier) If model is None, `predictions`=None This method should be passed to the data_generator field when testing model with Keras :param model: A Keras model with which to run inference. Default: None.

class medsegpy.data.OAI3DGenerator(config: medsegpy.config.Config)[source]¶

Bases: medsegpy.data.im_gens.OAIGenerator

Generator for training 3D networks where data is stored per slice

SUPPORTED_TAGS = ['oai_3d']¶
__load_corresponding_slices__(filepath)[source]¶

Loads volume that slice (filepath) corresponds to e.g. If each input volume consists of 4 slices, slices 1-4 will be in the same volume.

If filepath corresponds to slice 2, the volume (slices 1-4) and corresponding segmentations will be returned

Parameters

filepath – Filepath corresponding to single slice

Returns

tuple of 2 3d numpy array corresponding to 3d input volume and 3d segmentation volume (im_vol, seg_vol)

blockify_volume(im_volume: numpy.ndarray, seg_volume: numpy.ndarray)[source]¶
__blockify_volumes__(scan_volumes: dict)[source]¶

Split all volumes into blocks of size config.IMG_SIZE Throws error if volume is not perfectly divisible into blocks of size config.IMG_SIZE (Yi, Xi, Zi) :param scan_volumes: A dict of scan_ids –> (im_volume, seg_volume)

im_volume: 3D numpy array (Y, X, Z) seg_volume: 4D numpy array (Y, X, Z, #masks)

Returns

a list of tuples im_volume and corresponding seg_volume blocks im_volume block: a 3D numpy array of size Y/Yi, X/Xi, Z/Zi seg_volume block: a 3D numpy array of size Y/Yi, X/Xi, Z/Zi, #masks

__load_neighboring_slices__(num_slices, filepath, max_slice)[source]¶

Stacks 2D CT slices from single patient clipped at different window levels.

Overloads traditional 2.5D networks that look at neighboring slices.
